src:
Tradicija ispoštovana: Barnsli se provukao u 94. minutu
Još jedan efikasan meč starih rivala

01 Nov 2019

Neverovatna serija efikasnih utakmica Barnslija i Bristol Sitija nastavila se i večeras na otvaranju 15. kola Čempionšipa, a publika na Oukvelu imala je prilike da uprkos dosadnoj kiši i lošem vremenu gleda sjajan duel koji je odlučen u poslednjim minutima - 2:2 (0:1). Pravu golgotu od pakla do raja prošli su igrači Barnslija koji su lošim postavljanjem kod prekida omogućili favorizovanom Bristolu da lako stigne do prednosti od dva gola.
Prvo je legendarni velški defanzivac Ešli Viljams pogodio glavom u 43. minutu za vođstvo gostiju, a nakon još jednog lepog centaršuta švedskog veziste Elijasona (dve asistencije) i Austrijanac Endi Vajman je u 71. duplirao prednost za Bristol Siti.
Izgledalo je da će gosti upisati rutinski trijumf protiv jednog od najgorih timova u ligi, ali opet borbeni duh definitivno ne nedostaje igračima Barnslija.
Finski štoper Apo Halme (pristigao letos iz Lidsa) iskoristio je lep centaršut još jednog bivšeg prvotimca sa Eland Rouda Aleksa Movata da vrati svoj tim u igru u 74. minutu. Bio je to uvod u eksploziju koja je odjeknula Oukvelom i to u četvrtom minutu nadoknade kada je domaći napadač Koli Vudrou posle gužve uspeo da matira gostujućeg golmana i sačuva bod Barnsliju.
Bod koji je slaba uteha jer su ovom timu preko potrebne pobede kako bi pobegao sa dna tabele, ali bitno je da su ispoštovali tradiciju sa Bristolom pa sad imamo osam vezanih utakmica ovih rivala u svim takmičenjima na kojima je palo četiri i više golova.

ČEMPIONŠIP - 15. kolo

PetakBarnsli - Bristol Siti 2:2 (0:1)/Halme 77, Vudrou 90+4 - Vilijams 43, Vajman 71/

Subota13.30: (2,75) Vigan (3,20) Svonsi (2,65)16.00: (2,65) Blekburn (3,20) Šefild Venzdej (2,75)16.00: (1,60) Brentford (3,80) Hadersfild (5,70)16.00: (2,30) Derbi (3,20) Midlzbro (3,25)16.00: (1,65) Fulam (4,00) Hal (5,10)16.00: (2,05) Kardif (3,40) Birmingem (3,70)16.00: (1,55) Lids (4,10) KPR (6,00)16.00: (2,75) Luton (3,20) Notingem (2,75)16.00: (2,30) Reding (3,25) Milvol (3,20)


Nedelja13.00: (2,85) Čarlton (3,20) Preston (2,55)


Ponedeljak21.00: (2,95) Stouk (3,25) Vest Bromvič (2,45)

text:
Tradition respected: Barnsley slipped in the 94th minute
Another effective match of old rivals

01 Nov 2019

The incredible series of effective matches between Barnsley and Bristol City continued tonight in the opening round of the 15th Championship, and the audience at Oakwell had the opportunity to watch the brilliant duel decided in the final minutes despite the boring rain and bad weather - 2: 2 (0: 1 ). The real golgos from hell to paradise were passed by Barnsley players who, by poor set-up at intermission, allowed the favored Bristol to easily get the advantage of two goals.
First, legendary Welsh defender Ashley Williams hit his head in the 43rd minute to lead the visitors, and after another fine midfielder Swedish midfielder Eliasson (two assists) and Austrian Andy Wyman doubled the lead for Bristol City in the 71st.
It looked like the guests were about to enter a routine triumph against one of the worst teams in the league, but again the fighting spirit was definitely not lacking for Barnsley players.
Finnish midfielder Apo Halme (arriving from Leeds this summer) used the nice midfield of another former Eland Road champion, Alex Movat, to bring his team back into the game in the 74th minute. It was a prelude to an explosion that echoed Oakwell in the fourth minute of play when home striker Collie Woodrow managed to matt the away goalkeeper and save the score to Barnsley after the crowd.
A point that is a bit of a consolation as this team needs victories to get out of the bottom of the table, but it is important that they respect the tradition with Bristol, so now we have eight tied games of these rivals in all competitions with four or more goals scored.

CHAMPIONSHIP - Round 15

FridayBarnsley - Bristol City 2: 2 (0: 1) / Halme 77, Woodrow 90 + 4 - Williams 43, Wyman 71 /

Saturday13.30: (2.75) Wigan (3.20) Swansea (2.65) 16.00: (2.65) Blackburn (3.20) Sheffield Wednesday (2.75) 16.00: (1.60) Brentford ( 3.80) Huddersfield (5.70) 16.00: (2.30) Derby (3.20) Middlesbrough (3.25) 16.00: (1.65) Fulham (4.00) Hal (5.10) 16.00: (2.05) Cardiff (3.40) Birmingham (3.70) 16.00: (1.55) Leeds (4.10) KPR (6.00) 16.00: (2.75) Luton (3.20) Nottingham (2.75) 16.00: (2.30) Reading (3.25) Millwall (3.20)
